channel.title: Bit of a problem
channel.description:
I figured i'd post here so that i'd get less retarded comments like; "put shutdown -h"
So.. yeah my problem(s) is/are really that:
I need to work out a way to start the server run.bat from the folder above (/..) the server files
e.g: file structure:
C:\servers\files1\files.java C:\servers\run.bat
I want the run.bat to know where to look for the files, \files\ obviously.
Any ideas on this? i tried: java -Xmx1024m -cp ./files;./files/jython.jar;./files/MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server
but it says: [code]npc.cfg: file not found. npcdrops.cfg: file not found. autospawn.cfg: file not found. item.cfg: file not found. shops.cfg: file not found. ScorpionScape Server made darkandlightjak5 on 0.0.0.0:43594 config\objects.cfg: file not found. [/code]
so im a bit confused on that one...
my other problem is that im not too sure how to specify the port on which each priv server runs on. could someone point me in the right direction?
kthx.

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

thiefmn6092:

People like lothy ruin moparscape! They are just TOO sexy for us all! true story.

I didn’t say I agreed with him doing that. That’s what I thought he was trying to do though.

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:10, topic:126033”][quote author=USMC link=topic=176305.msg1624239#msg1624239 date=1185249482]

how do i compiled?

blah blah blah
[/quote]i thought you might have been intelligent so i let the path problem slide, but that is too far.

it is people like YOU that is what is wrong with this community, not aftermath, as you are running a server without the faintest clue of how it works.

as for finding the port, i dont suppose it ever occurred to you to see where the serversocket is created?[/quote]
I agree. I kept telling myself that this was a joke posting, a satirical topic of sorts, aiming to make the Moparscape Vets look/feel stupid. I was very wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @USMC USMC
item.description:
@USMC wrote:

Aftermath:

how do i compiled?

Aftermath, you are a fine example of the minority that ruin the mopar forums these days,
you write server crashers, your arrogant, and most of all, unhelpful, last time i saw, you wrote that program that got all the servers from the ss page and attacked them, now really, do you have nothing better do to with your time than ruin peoples work? i mean, honestly ask yourself, do you have a social life?

Yes, lets all agree, i may not be as clued up on private servers, as you, but know for a fact, when someone asks me for help, scar scripting for example, i am always happy to help them, i just remember once i was new, and people HELPED me, thats was what made kaitnieks forums what it was.

Please, someone do the world a favour and ban this clown.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @USMC USMC
item.description:
@USMC wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The port is hardcoded into the server, so you would have to change the source and recompile. (or make it read the port from a text file, or as a command line argument)

please could you elaborate on that?
e.g. which file?

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @USMC USMC
item.description:
@USMC wrote:

thanks people!
not quite the solution i was looking for, but _frank’s idea of cd … gave me the idea of just putting cd files/ above the commands.

sorted now, thanks,

and ideas on the ports though?

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of a problem
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

um, if you used packages, then:

java package1.ClassName

Otherwise:

[quote=“frank_, post:2, topic:126033”]imo change directory before you start the server in the script

cd …
java <args 'ere> server[/quote]

Read full topic
